newsitem.title: USA: Porsche to make sport utility vehicle.
newsitem.headline: Porsche to make sport utility vehicle.

text.p: German sports car maker Porsche AG said Tuesday it plans to enter the sport utility vehicle market.
"It's only a question of time, not the decision. The decision is made," Porsche Chairman Wendelin Wiedeking told a news conference at the North American International Auto Show.
The company's plan "is to bring this product to the market this century," he said.
Wiedeking said Porsche was talking to a third party about the vehicles but would not say whether Porsche or the third party would make them. He did not identify the party.
The move into the growing sport utility market is part of Porsche's plan to sell high performance vehicles other than sports cars, he said.
Porsche also said it expects its new Boxster sports car to help it double its sales in the United States this year.

The company is confident the introduction of the car "will double 1996 U.S. sales this year to approximately 14,000," Fred Schwab, Porsche Cars North America president, told reporters at the auto show.

With a manufacturers suggested retail price of $39,980, the two-seat Boxster is priced below the Porsche 911. It includes a 2.5 litre 201 horsepower engine and can go from zero to 62 mph in 6.9 seconds, Schwab said. The car has a top track speed of 149 mph.
